metadata.titel_preek: Apocryphal or Real?: All Saints Day

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from human entropy and 'dusty death' to the divine recreation of all things through the Lamb.

tekstueel_bewijs: God will wipe away every tear
He who sat upon the throne said, 'Behold, I make all things new'
The God who raised his Son Jesus Christ from the dead is a God who is able to keep his promises

object.identificatie: The New Creation / Eternal Life / Restoration of the Human Person
tekstueel_bewijs: a new heaven and a new earth
the dwelling of God is with humanity
these words are actually promises from the living God

ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver who is currently suffering under the Opponent.

helper.identificatie: Jesus Christ / The Revelation / The Holy Spirit (implied)
tekstueel_bewijs: the Lamb in the midst of the throne will be their shepherd
the Revelation of Jesus Christ himself
helper.rol_van_god: God is both Subject and Helper (as the Lamb).
helper.rol_van_geest: External help (Revelation as a 'glimpse' drawn back).

tekstueel_bewijs: the pain and disappointment of life
the hearts of men are full of evil
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not a moral failing but the ontological reality of death and the 'emptiness' of the human condition apart from God.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The intellectual struggle of the believer to trust the promise amidst the evidence of entropy.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Thinking Christian
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (believing) is dependent on the primary program (God's acting) being 'real' rather than 'apocryphal'.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God will wipe away every tear
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we have a job of work to do
we have to live in the tension
we realize that the happier days are behind us

voorbeelden: we Christians have a job of work to do
all of us... want to know the answers
understand and appreciate All Saints Day
you figure out which one is in the Bible
The only power that can make it different is the power of God
a God who is able to keep his promises

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon centers on God's 'Pouvoir' (Power/Ability) to overcome the 'Non-Pouvoir' (Inability) of humans facing death.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Starts at S2 (Ecclesiastes), rejects ~S1 (Apocrypha/Wishful thinking), moves to S1 (Revelation) via the power of God.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved not by human effort but by the 'Eternal Word of God' which is external to the system of vanity.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; the preacher insists on the reality of death and decay before introducing grace.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It identifies the human condition as one of total inability (Ecclesiastes) and places the entire burden of rescue on God's active power.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: we Christians have a job of work to do to get All Saints Day back

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of eschatological verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Behold, I make all things new.
Man has no advantage over the beasts; for all is vanity.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (David, etc.) are not used as moral models; rather, the 'Saints' are receivers of God's mercy.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The saints are defined by what God has done for them (washed their robes), not what they did.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and hope grounded in external promise rather than internal performance.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'lowdown' of Ecclesiastes to the 'vision' of Revelation is logically and narratively seamless.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'tough-minded skepticism' and 'resplendent assurance'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The God who raised his Son Jesus Christ from the dead is a God who is able to keep his promises.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is not explicitly mentioned, though the 'Revelation' functions as a gift of Savoir-faire (knowing the end of the book).

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin and death are fused into a state of 'vanity' that humans cannot escape.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is driven by God's promise. The human subject is correctly positioned as one who suffers and receives.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly high on Savoir (knowing the Bible quiz).
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain the focus on Pouvoir (God's power).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Link the 'job of work' in the intro more clearly to a response of gratitude rather than a standalone duty.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's promise) clearly grounds the Ethics (the 'job of work' and 'fighting the good fight').

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in theocentric preaching that refuses to bypass the 'grave' to get to the 'glory'.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the use of Macbeth and the NYT, semiotics reveals that these are 'Opponents' to the 'Sender's' message.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the dating of Sirach; semiotics focuses on how Sirach functions as a 'false helper' (wishful thinking) compared to the 'true subject' in Revelation.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas helps see that the preacher is performing a 'Subject-switch': moving the hearer from a Subject of their own destiny to a Receiver of God's act.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses a 'via negativa' approach, establishing the total failure of the human actant before introducing the divine actant.
